intro: Verbascum jankae, commonly known as the Janka's mullein, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, velvety leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
